alert.note: Alert for Western Arctic Coast (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 21 at 5:40AM AKST until January 22 at 6:00PM AKST by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM AKST SATURDAY... * WHAT...Very cold wind chills to 55 below occuring, and blowing snow with low visibility expected. Plan on difficult travel conditions. East winds gusting to 35 mph will cause areas of blowing and drifting snow with visibility one half mile or less at times. * WHERE...From Point Lay west. * WHEN...Until 6 PM Saturday. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Wind chills to 55 below will continue into tonight. East winds will increase through tonight with gusts to 35 mph tonight and Saturday. This will cause blowing and drifting snow with low visibility tonight and Saturday. Cold wind chills as low as 55 below zero will cause frostbite in as little as 10 minutes to exposed skin. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... A Winter Weather Advisory for blowing snow means periods of blowing snow will cause travel difficulties.
